definition: local militia formed to suppress peasant rebellion (old)
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: Q. Which is better with Catherine, solo or group?
sentences.chinese: 對凱瑟林來說單練好還是團練好？

sentences.english: After the war, civil corps turned to the force maintaining regional order there.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭結束後，團練轉化爲維護地方秩序的力量。

sentences.english: Without whichever cause at the time that lotus taught, one province in Hubei dragged have 300,000 regiments do.
sentences.chinese: 平白蓮教的時候，湖北一省就拉起了三十萬團練。

sentences.english: Any competitions and trainings will be announced in this board.
sentences.chinese: 所有比賽事宜及團練會在此版公告。

sentences.english: The local military power also developed on account of bandit problems at that time.
sentences.chinese: 又因爲盜匪問題，地方團練反而得以發展。

definition: place where the emperor listened to lectures (traditional)
Tang and Song dynasty provincial governor, in Tang times having military and civil authority, but only civil authority in Song
to banish from the court/to relegate
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
to be involved in politics/participation in politics
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
Anlu county level city in Xiaogan 孝感[Xiao4 gan3], Hubei
Guixi county level city in Yingtan 鷹潭|鹰潭, Jiangxi
Longxi county in Dingxi 定西[Ding4 xi1], Gansu
